results.title: Sustainable Ouyen
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Several years ago a group of Ouyen Primary School students petitioned their local council to adopt a community-recycling program. To everybody’s surprise the council not only provided an unprecedented household recycling service but did so at a loss. Since that time the community has launched a number of forward thinking initiatives with solar power, sustainable agriculture and improved water usage. Whether it’s the Ouyen Football Club, High School or local farmers, there’s an understanding that sustainable practices must be employed now in order for future Ouyen generations to benefit.

results.title: Sunraysia Ukulele Network
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: An unlikely group of people come together once a month to share their love of the Ukulele. They meet on the last Sunday of each month at a local landmark called The Old Cottage where they play the uke and have a sing-a-long. Everyone is welcome, from beginners to more experienced players, the door is always open.

results.title: About my dad
results.creator_credit: Huong Duy Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Like his father, Huong Duy Pham was also a soldier in the South Vietnam Army. But his family connections were to prove too dangerous and Huong eventually escaped by boat and made his way to Australia where he is now living with his wife and three sons. He dedicates this story to his father.

results.title: The Legendary Rex
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description:
The Rex Theatre, in Charlton, was built in 1938 and opened with the film ‘Mary, Queen of Scots’. David Pollard, who worked as a projectionist at the theatre since 1980, takes us on a tour of this historic theatre. He is the Chairperson of the Charlton Community Theatre and has been working towards getting The Rex into community ownership, as there is not a large population base for the theatre to be commercially viable.
The community has offered voluntary labour and raised over $80,000 and with the help of fundraising from the federal government, it is hoped the theatre will eventually be completely in the hands of the community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kim Montgomery, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI

results.title: Cook's Family Farm
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Meet the Cook family and spend time with three generations as they muster and milk cows. Robert and Patricia are the proud parents of five grown up sons and 22 grandchildren. Brothers, Ross and Steve Cook have returned to share-farm with their mum and dad and there is no other place they would rather be. Surrounded by rolling hills and the winery county of the King Valley in northern Victoria, the Cook family have worked hard to keep and grow their dairy farm.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Pat Vines joined the Australian Navy as a nurse during World War II. She moved up the ranks and eventually became a Commander. Pat tells her story through her memories of wartime and what it was like to work in the Navy.

results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sue Phillips, Sandra Buchan and Geoff Milne take us on a tour of the Eldorado Museum and share the rich history of the pioneering families who established infrastructure and made the northern Victorian town of Eldorado what it is in 2012.

results.title: Deirdre Jack: Swifts Creek Artist
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Local painter, Deirdre Jack, is passionate about her local environment. The rolling hills and golden fields that surround her Swifts Creek bush studio inevitably make their way into her vibrant oil paintings and pastel sketches. Fruit, however, is the main subject of her exhibition at the Great Alpine Gallery, a small exhibition space that sits in the heart of Swifts Creek and run voluntarily by a group of fellow artists. The gallery has been a vital place for local artists since 1989 despite the challenges of running an art space in a small rural town.

results.title: The Reserve
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Hutchinson, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film shows what a group of passionate individuals can achieve to create a place for the whole town to enjoy. Volunteers and paid workers dedicated their time and energy to cleaning up Crown land in the middle of Nanneella. With assistance from the whole town and surrounding area the Nanneella Bushland Reserve is now used by the community for bonfires, social gatherings or just to sit and enjoy a picnic.

results.title: Swell Mamas
results.creator_credit: Matt Blackwood, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lucy and Geraldine have been the best of friends since school, when they both became mums they decided that their love of surfing and of being in the water would not take a back seat, so they started ‘Swell Mamas’. Dozens of mums across Inverloch in south-eastern Victoria, get together every Friday morning to connect, to laugh, to share and to feel the water wash over them.
